text: the passenger side door and club cab door on a wood truck were damaged.  no injuries. on may 16, 2019 at approximately 14:00 hours, the wood lease operator arrived at the wu 12-12-4676 well site.  he was tasked with removing water out of the gas meter on the well.  while performing the task, he walked around his truck and identified a drip with a tire around it that was 10 feet from the truck as an obstacle he needed to avoid.  after he completed the task, he got into his truck to leave.  while driving out of the location, he forgot about the drip and contacted the passenger side of the truck on the drip valve.  the contact damaged the driver’s door and the club cab door.  there was no damage to the well infrastructure.  there were no injuries. the lease operator reported the incident to his supervisor and the hse specialist.

an 80 foot jlg aerial lift contacted an energized natural gas line.  a team member was attempting to park a jlg 800s (80 ft) aerial lift on the east side of heavy haul road when he contacted an energized 16-inch natural gas line with the rear boom section of the aerial lift. the contact resulted in the 16-inch line shifting 1 ½ inches on the pipe support and bending a u-bolt support located approximately 15 feet up the the line from the point of contact. a spotter was being utilized at the time of the incident. the operator stated that the boom controls malfunctioned while he was backing near the energized gas line which prevented him from stopping the lift before it contacted the line. there were no injuries associated with this incident. an investigation is underway.close out notation - incident was reclassified based upon elt/hsse review. internal irp was conducted and is attached as part of the investigation. incident was reported. incident scene was secured. operator and spotter received post incident screening. investigation initiated.

wood supervisor bumped his hard hat, resulting in a minor scratch. a wood employee was descending from the scaffold at the top of the super heater (north side). when he reached the lower scaffolding platform he ducked down to go under a pipeline, but he did not realize there was another pipe immediately after the initial pipe and his hard hat made contact with the second pipe. resulting in a minor scratch. the employee reported this event immediately and went to the contractor clinic where he received first aid treatment. the employee was released back to work without restrictions.  #name?

employee communicated a positive confirmation for covid-19  an employee reported a confirmed positive test for covid-19 to site management. the employee has been in isolation. wood is identifying those who may have worked in proximity.  appropriate notifications have been completed.

debris in right eye of wh -appropriate ppe utilized migrated from legacy cairs incident #35958on 11/16/17 wh was assisting his welder on cleaning the weld on a 20" section of pipe using a wire wheel attachment. ip (injured employee) stated that he felt debris bounce off of his shirt and up under his spoggles. he stated to have immediate irritation in his right eye but went away. later on that night he continued to feel discomfort, so notified his immediate supervisor and welder of the incident at approximately 7:30 am on 11/17/17 the following day. safety arrived to location and was able to rinse out debris in his right eye. ip stated to have immediate relief and no further discomfort. as a precaution the ip was taken to see the optometrist, who found no further debris and recommended that he use over-the-counter lubrication drops. unsafe behavior: safety inspected the spoggles used and found that there was a gap on the bottom of the frame, allowing the potential for debris to float in. also the ip did not report the incident the day it occurred. corrective actions: different frames of spoggles will be purchased and available to fit different facial structures. ip was coached by his supervisor and safety of the importance of immediate notification, so that first aid measures could be administered, and reporting can begin in a timely matter. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

category: hand or arm injury, foot or leg injury
text: subcontractor employee came in contact with grinder blade and cut his finger. migrated from legacy cairs incident #30214a fabricator; after conducting grinding activities on a 1 “ beam ; the fabricator placed the grinder on the said beam and took off his gloves to wipe the sweat from his forehead; at that very moment the ip saw the grinder falling and attempted to catch the grinder. he caught the grinder by the blade and suffered a minor laceration on his right index finger .immediate corrective action taken: the job was stopped. the injured party was immediately treated and given a band aid and returned to work within 20 minutes follow up actions: stand down to be given with the team ;engaging the team on 1. proper use and placement of hand tools 2. proper house keeping 3. safe work practice when conducting cutting and grinding operation migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

ee was cutting tubing to a chemical pump when residual pressure released, splashing a minor amount of scale inhibitor on ee on april 30, 2020 at 11:00 am, a wood employee was changing out tubing to a chemical pump at the tinsley eor facility in bentonia, ms. as ee began to cut into the tubing, a small amount of residual pressure caused scale inhibitor to spray onto the ee causing minor discomfort. ee washed off the scale inhibitor and reported incident to supervision. axiom was engaged and first aid measures were recommended.

short circuit in 440v cubicle short circuit in 440v cubicle in electrical switchroom. at the time of cairs submission, no more information available. a/w hse report to be released by client. electrical cubicle made safe. no further information available at time of cairs submission. a/w hse report from client

mtc; amcs (cc2210); left shoulder dislocation; ks-2016-0055 worker was in the process of repositioning a chain fall.  while changing their position on the beam, the ip’s foot slipped causing the ip to fall approx. 20 inches. the ip caught himself with his elbows resulting in a separation of the left shoulder. worker was in the process of repositioning a chain fall, while changing their position on the beam, the ip’s foot slipped causing the ip to fall 20 inches. the ip caught himself with his elbows resulting in a separation of the left shoulder.

category: lifting or moving loads, vehicle incident general
text: minor damage to track hoe. migrated from legacy cairs incident #39919a wood employee got into a track hoe and began to clean out a trench where recent hammering of rock had occurred. while doing so, the employee curled bucket of track hoe back into the bottom of cab and ladder step causing minor damage.employee was tasked with standing near the work to take grade shots while rock hammering was taking place. the foreman receiveda call indicating problems with the hammer and walked back over to the area where the work was taking place noticed damage to the frontof the excavator. the operator of the hammer hoe informed the foremanhe did notice how damage occurred. the foreman then asked the employee who was taking grade shots and was informed that he had wanted to help therefore had jumped into the damaged excavator and began to clean the trench ofrock and debris and that while doing so hadpulled the bucket up to close the cab and curled the bucket into the bottom of the cab causing minor damage. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

pump got damaged and a part of insulation started smoldering. while performing chemical cleaning in the psa the altena pump got damaged (system for seal cooling). due to the damge a part of the insulation on the top of the pump (exhaust) started to smolder as teh pump overheated. altena stopped the pump immediately without further consequences. after the event the pump was replaced for another pump on sunday the 8th of october. #name?

coolant cap lose on the hydrovac truck migrated from legacy cairs incident #31429spilled coolant onto matting. lose coolant cap on hydrovac truck.retightened coolant cap, clean up with sorbent pads on matting.discussed incident with crew.sorbent pads were bagged and transported to yard for disposal in hazmat (contaminated materials disposal), migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

during building inspection, subcontractor hit head on low crossmember that was directly over walkway. during building inspection, subcontractor was walking/inspecting building attic. attic was dimly lit, subcontractor was using a light, but was not wearing a hard hat at the time and hit head on low crossmember that was directly over walkway. subcontractor had a bump on head and was feeling dizzy so was taken to nearby hospital for evaluation. wood site manager notified pm and hse manager.

category: hand or arm injury, head or face injury
text: wg employee was checking an oil tank and felt a sharp discomfort on his inner forearm and on the right side of his head. there was minor swelling/redness reported to the affect areas. axiom was contacted and first aid measures were appropriate. migrated from legacy cairs incident #34202wg employee was checking an oil tank and felt a sharp discomfort on his inner forearm and on the right side of his head, approximately cheek level. he then noticed several wasps surrounding him. there was minor swelling/redness reported to the affected areas. axiom was contacted and first aid measures were appropriate for this injury. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

one wood employee tested positive for covid 19 while on days off.  one wood employee tested positive for covid 19 while on days off on 8/13/21. ee's symptoms have subsided and will continue to quarantine and monitor. no contact tracing required.  ee instructed to isolate by his primary care physician.

category: lifting or moving loads, vehicle incident general
text: a sbi driver was rear ended while driving his company vehicle, resulting in rear quarter panel damage to the pickup. no injuries occurred. migrated from legacy cairs incident #31056a sbi driver was pulling off of the highway into a gravel area, when another third party driver that was following the sbi driver, struck the sbi vehicle in the passenger rear of the truck. the collision resulted in body damage to the pickup and significant front end damage to the offending driver. no injuries were sustained by either party as the speeds had been reduced in preparation for pulling into the gravel area. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

the wood ip had an allergic reaction to the smoke from the wildfires that was in the air.   after being outside for 40 minutes, the ip’s allergies were irritated by the smoke from the wildfires and he became short of breath, dizzy and developed a headache.  he got back in his truck, closed the windows and turned on the air conditioner.  before driving back to his home to get an inhaler which the ip had forgot to take with him in the morning, he called his cop foreman.  the cop foreman requested that he call axiom.  the ip called axiom and received first aid measures.  the actual severity is a b1 because the ip only required first aid measures and his inhaler.  the potential severity is a b1 because it was unlikely that his allergic reaction would have required more than first aid measures. the ip called his cop foremen to let him know he needed to drive to town and get an inhaler.  the cop foreman told the ip to call axiom even though it was not work related.  ip called axiom.

oncoming vehicle crossed to the wrong side of the road and collided into wood vehicle  whilst driving to work a wood vehicle being driven by a technician was hit by an oncoming vehicle that crossed onto the wrong side of the road and into his path of travel. the technician's vehicle sustained major damage and was towed from the scene, emergency services attended the scene. the technician was assessed by ambulance officers and did not require further medical assistance. another wood tech arrived on the scene shortly after impact and assisted ip and cared for him afterwards. another wood technician attended to assist. the technician was alcohol tested by police and returned 0.0%bac.

the oim left all his things in his locker and when he returned to the plataform the key of the locker was not at the same place that he left and his shaving kit with norelco shaver phillips was not inside the locker anymore. migrated from legacy cairs incident #31201the oim left all his things in his locker and when he left the plataform he had all his things locked up on his locker with a key on the right side of a hook hanging in the room the black shaving kit was on the self inside of his locker at the time. when he returned to the polvo a and went to his room he noticed thar the key was put on the left side of set of hooks. it was when he noticed that someone had taken his shaving kit with norelco shaver phillips beard trimmers, all razors and shave cream. so he let the safety officer know that this had been taken from the oim cabin. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

employee became ill at work, was refered to hospital for examination. migrated from legacy cairs incident #31321. employee felt sick and faint. asked for help, both first aider and manager organised transport to the hospital for further checks. he was detained over night for observations and tests, released the next day on bed rest. a report has been requested by the company to ascertain if fit for work duties migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

while carrying a 4 foot long 4”x4”x 3/8” section of angle iron, ee tripped on a rock and stumbled and felt a pull in his back.  ee was carrying a 4 foot long 4”x4”x 3/8” section of angle iron.  while walking, he tripped on a rock and stumbled.  he did not lose control of the angle iron after he stumbled but did feel a slight pull in the lower right side of his back.  provide on-site first aid inspected the area and removed the rock from walk way provided employee with anti-fog wipes

category: general injury, head or face injury
text: ip was crouched down while retrieving material and when he went to stand up he struck his head on a beam that was directly above his head. ip was retrieving a section of unistrut in an area where there was only approx. 1200mm headroom.  he straightened up as he was getting a pair of sidecutters from his pocket and as he did so he struck his head on a beam that was directly above him. (he was wearing a hard hat and full ppe.)   he felt a pain in his neck but continued working until the end of his shift.  he reported what had happened to his supervisor and told his supervisor that he would wait until the morning before deciding if he would tell the medic.  his supervisor did not report the incident at this point.  ip reported to the medic on 22/2 and advised he was experiencing mild pain and was given ibuprofen gel and he returned to work.   he returned to the medic on  23/2 and was given ibuprofen tablets and paracetamol and returned to work.  on 23/2 he returned to the medic and was given prescription medication following a consultation with the topside doctor.  he did not complete his shift due to being given prescription medication.  the decision was then taken to send him ashore as a precautionary measure for review by isos .  he attended at isos at 1700 hrs on 24/2 and the consulting doctor advised him to rest and declared him unfit for any work until he is reviewed next week.  ip treated by medic and following deterioration in his condition and in consultation with doctor ip was medivaced ashore to isos for review.  all staff reminded for need to report incidents immediately

ip tested positive. contacts trace/testing resulted in no additional cases. international tower closed as a precaution. ip tested positive. contacts trace/testing resulted in no additional cases. international tower closed as a precaution. contacts trace/testing resulted in no additional cases. international tower closed as a precaution.

while lifting and setting down sample train from an elevated stand, employee strained lower back. lifting air sampling equipment from an elevated stand to the ground, where it was then being lifted and brought across the roof to the another sample port. halfway through a test the two sample trains need to be swapped to access the second sample port.  while lifting and setting down sample train from an elevated stand, employee strained lower back.  posture was not ideal given a tarp that was positioned in such a way that required employee to bend slightly while lowering the equipment workcare contacted and self care instructions given.
ip tested positive for covid. ip tested positive for covid. ip isolated. no ccs

dropped object –(37.28kj minor)- 400mm length of 40mm x 40mm unistrut fell 3.8 metres   scaffolders erecting in the area of the loggs rack disturbed a piece of unistrut weighing 1kg that had been left on a cable tray approximately 3.8m high. the unistrut fell to grade close to the scaffold team.  the area in which the unistrut fell was already cordoned off for the scaffolding activities. investigation ongoing. investigation initiated, pictures taken of the area and a statement was taken.  a sweep of the site has taken place to check for any potential dropped objects that maybe hidden away and not seen from grade level.

ee was exiting the rental car at the project when felt pain in lower back.  ee was sitting in the rental vehicle taking a water break and cooling down in the ac.  ee claims they opened the door, stepped out of the vehicle, and felt a sharp pain in their lower left back. ee had a hard time walking so a coworker helped get back to the hotel to rest.  ee self treated and did not need to seek medical attention. coworker drove ee back to hotel to rest. ee called hse coordinator and was advised to call workcare for selfcare advice.

planned down man of non-essential personnel (including 5 wood) due to asset pot water pumps being frozen. migrated from legacy cairs incident #36542the wood bp north sea contract employ a team to conduct repair order work on bp etap on a 3x3 rota. in addition other wood personnel visit the asset to support the contract or bp with subsea surveys or other work.mobilisation to bp etap is normally through babcock via helicopter direct to the asset.around 9/2/18 - 12/2/18 a team of 4 contract personnelp brooker, j nangle, c newall and p thomsonmobilised to the asset in order to conduct pre-tar work scopes. chris newall was appointed as wood foremen and established good communication avenues with the contract onshore construction team including david borg, construction coordinator.on 26/2/18 david renniemobilised as part of an sts survey on behalf of bp.at 14:00 hours on wednesday 28th february 2018 all persons on bp etap were advised by the oim that they would have to conduct a controlled down man of non-essential personnel as a result of the potable water pump being frozen and therefore not servicing the asset with requirements to operate.this information was passed to the wood contract team who arranged suitable accommodation in aberdeen for the following day.during the morning of thursday 1st march 2018, the 5 wood persons were flown onshore from bp etap over 2 different helicopter demobs. said persons were met by david borg, contract construction coordinator and provided accommodation at the jurys inn, dyce, aberdeen.during conversation the team expressed no issues with the process carried out and were advised of the process thereon which would be dictated by the asset becoming suitably available to mobilise to once more. scheduled demob for the team being monday 5th march 2018.circumstances were relayed to the hse team and a cairs notification form completed. wood er team and relevant contract persons notified through courtesy that the contract had the matter in hand. reported on cairs for information.personnel expected to mobilise to complete work 9/3/18 or 12/3/18. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

exposure to environmental heat an employee was working outside most of the day landscaping, tilling, and laying out straw roll. he was driving a tractor tilling the ground when he started to feel exhausted, was excessively sweating, and felt like he was overheating. he went inside to drink some water. he felt nauseous and threw up. he was hospitalized with heat exhaustion, an acute kidney injury, and dehydration.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was threading up a draw block on machine d21 (drawer) in jog mode. during the task, the employee was putting a chain on the draw block to pull wire through it. the employee had their hand under the chain to check the tension. the chain became tight and flipped up on the draw block, pinching and injuring the employee's finger.
nonclassifiable an employee suffered an amputation while working in the facility.

text: struck by object falling from vehicle or machinery-other than vehicle part an employee was loading a roll of paper (500 to 800 lbs.) from a railcar onto a powered industrial vehicle (piv) when the roll fell on top of the employee's piv protective cage. the employee raised his hand to protect himself and his fingers went outside of the cage and were crushed between the bar of the cage and the roll of paper. as a result, he sustained a partial amputation of his left index finger and debridement of his left middle finger.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was using a drill press to bore a piece of wood. the drill bit caught the glove on his left hand, resulting in the amputation of his left thumb.

category: hand or arm injury, dropped object or material, vehicle incident general
text: struck by object falling from vehicle or machinery-other than vehicle part an employee was lifting a 1,000-pound piece with a magnetic lifting device. the piece fell and struck the employee's right arm, lacerating it and requiring hospitalization.
overexertion in holding, carrying, or wielding-single episode an employee was carrying a box of paper and suffered a hernia.

category: slips & trips, fall from or working at height issue
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified an employee was getting down from a truck and fell backwards off the truck.
inhalation of harmful substance-single episode an employee was mixing chemicals for a pool when he breathed in fumes that burned his throat.

category: fall from or working at height issue, general injury
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified a truck driver was in the back of a trailer, clearing it out after a delivery. the driver began to climb out of the trailer using a ladder leaning against it; the ladder kicked out and the employee fell to the pavement, suffering a broken hip and bruised ribs.
exposure to environmental heat an employee was packing muffins into containers and felt ill. she was hospitalized with heat exhaustion/dehydration.

struck against moving part of machinery or equipment employee was cutting a 10-foot length of 6-inch pvc pipe into 10-inch sections. he was using a chop saw that was on a pivot because the tool he had been using would not cut the pipe. the employee was using his hand to hold the pipe.  his hand got pulled into the blade.
